metadata.title: CVE-2020-14152 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c in djpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causing excessive memory consumption.

notes.note: mdeslaur> looks like this was fixed a long time ago in libjpeg-turbo

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3-0ubuntu2').
libjpeg6b package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
libjpeg9 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9d-1').
